intro: Wormskioldia serrata, commonly known as the serrated wormskioldia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features finely toothed leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
